p:
α-Glucosidase (AGH) solution was prepared from rat intestinal acetone powder by partial modification of the procedure reported by Oki et al. [ 57]. 100 mg of intestinal acetone powder (Sigma-Aldrich Chemical Co.; St. Louis, MO, USA) was added to 3 mL of 0.9% NaCl solution, homogenized with the sonication and kept in an ice bath. After centrifugation at 6000 rpm for 30 min at 4 °C, the resulting supernatant was kept cold and directly subjected to inhibitory assay. The method of Adisakwattana et al. [ 58] was used to determine AGH inhibitory assay. The assay was defined as the percent inhibition under the assay conditions, which was calculated according to the formula:
Percent inhibition = (A o − A s/A o) × 100
Where A o is the absorbance of the control, and A s is the absorbance of the mixture containing the test compound. The data were presented as the average of the triplicate analyses.
